       The   City Journal             
          (USPS: 114-540)             
        Published Weekly              
        Under Authority of            
    City Ordinance No. 30050          
       by City of St. Louis           
      Parrie L. May, Register         
         1206 Market Street           
         Room 118 City Hall           
     St. Louis, Missouri 63103        
 Yearly Subscription . . . . $30.00   
         IN ADVANCE                   
 Copies for sale and distribution at  
       Room 118 City Hall             
     Periodicals postage paid at      
         St. Louis, Missouri          
Postmaster: send address              
changes to City Journal, Register's   
Office. 1206 Market Street, Room      
118, St. Louis, Missouri, 63103.      
     JOURNAL                     
      OF THE                     
  Board of                       
  Aldermen                       
      OF THE                     
 CITY OF ST. LOUIS               
     REGULAR                     
      SESSION                    
     2006-2007                   
 PRELIMINARY                     
  The Board of Aldermen is       
   currently not in session.     
   The Board will resume         
       meetings on               
 Friday, September 15, 2006.     
   BOARD OF                                    
 PUBLIC SERVICE                                
          REGULAR MEETING                      
    St. Louis, MO - August 15, 2006            
      Present: Directors Visintainer, Siedhoff,
 Bess, Kincaid and Simon.                      
      Absent: Directors Suelmann and           
 President Melton. (excused)                   
      In the absence of the President, Board   
 of Public Service, the Director of Health and 
 Hospitals was appointed President pro tem.    
      All actions pertaining to the Director of
 Streets and the President, Board of Public    
 Service shall be the Special Order of the Day 
 by the Board.                                 
     Minutes of the Regular Meeting of         
 August 8, 2006 were unanimously approved.     
      The following documents were referred    
 by the Secretary:                             
             August 10, 2006                   
       To the Directors of Public Utilities and
 Streets: 111699, AT&T, place 750' of          
 ANMW-9 cable and 750' of 24 strand fiber      
 from the AT&T manhole at the intersection     
 of Montgomery and Glasgow down                
 Montgomery to the west approximately 2'       
 off the curb, etc., 111700, AT&T, bore a 100  
 pair copper cable 230' from an AT&T manhole   
 east to the customers property line at 3641   
 will feed a 4" S.O.C. placed by customer; bore
 will run approximately 2' off the property    
line up to the site at 3641 Ol i've, 111701,      
AT&T, bore 115' from an AT&T manhole              
located at the intersection of Hebert & Glasgow   
over to a new easement acquired at the            
northwest corner of Hebert and Glasgow,           
111702, AT&T, bore 65' from an AT&T               
manhole located between Barrett & Harper          
on Glasgow over to a new easement acquired        
on the north side of the alley between Barrett    
and Glasgow.                                      
     To the Directors of Parks, Recreation        
and Forestry and Health and Hospitals:            
111703, St. Louis Scottish Games, hold St.        
Louis Scottish Games and Cultural Festival        
on October 6-7, 2006 in Forest Park Golf          
Driving Range Oct. 6, 2006.                       
     To the Directors of Streets, Parks and       
Health and Hospitals: 111704, Soulard             
Octoberfest, hold the Soulard Octoberfest on      
October 6,7, & 8 2006 in Soulard Park from        
Oct. 6-8, 2006.                                   
      To the Directors of Streets and Health      
and Hospitals: 111705, Downtown St. Louis         
Partnership, hold a block party on Olive b/t      
6th and 7th on September 8, 2006, 111706,         
Epiphany Of Our Lord Catholic Church, hold        
annual Parish Homecoming on September 15-         
16, 2006 on Smiley b/t Ivanhoe and Murdoch.,      
111707, Arts Council Of Lafayette Park, hold      
Taste of Lafayette Park & Free Concerts event     
on September 9, 2006 in Lafayette Park            
     To the Directors of Health and               
Hospitals: 111708, St. Nicholas Day Care          
Center, conduct a day care center at 1805         
Lucas, 111709, House of Montessori                
Education, conduct a day care center at 6116      
Michigan, 111710, Honey Bee Plus Child            
Education Center, conduct a day care center       
at 4450 Virginia, 111711, Juz Kidz Day Care       
Center, conduct a day care center at 950 Laurel.  
             August 11, 2006                      
     To the President and Director of Streets:    
111712, National Council of the Lewis & Clark     
Bicentennial, hold an Inspirational Final         
Ceremony for the commemoration of the             
Lewis & Clark Expedition on September 24,         
2006 from 11:00 a.m. - 12:00 noon on Eads         
Bridge (bridge closure 9:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m.)     
      To the Directors of Public Utilities and    
Public Safety: 111713, Marvin & Rhonda            
Daniels, consolidate property at the              
intersection of the north line of Washington      
and the east line of N. Taylor at 4455            
Washington in C.B. 3759.                          
    To the Director of Streets: 111714,           
Washington Avenue Post LLC, encroach with         
banner at 1312 Washington.                        
    To the Directors of Health and Hospitals      
and Public Safety: 111715, Kiddiversity,          
 conduct a day center at 3401 Chippewa,          
 111716, Like Our Own Childcare Center,          
 LLC, to conduct a day care center at 2708 N.    
 22nd.                                           
             August 15, 2006                     
       To the Directors of Public Utilities and  
 Public Safety: 111728, Allen Irving, Grand      
 Addition Resubdivision of part of Block 1,      
 resubdivision of Lot 2 at 3930 Page in C.B.     
 3741, 111729, JRG Ventures, LLC, McNair         
 Avenue subdivision, Lot 9 and part of Lot 10    
 of the Allen's Lafayette Park Addition at 2215  
 McNair (2 Fee Simple) and 17 in C.B. 1386,      
 111730, Richard Codd Properties, LLC, a         
 parcel of land to be subdivided and known as    
 3208-10 Morganford Road Townhouse               
 Subdivision in C.B. 4153, 111731, James W.      
 Mundloch, Ohio Avenue Subdivision, Lot 34       
 and part of Lot 33 of New Berlin Subdivision    
 at 3713 Ohio (2 Fee Simple) and 15 in C.B.      
 1643, 111732, 7171 Delmar, LLC, a lot split     
 of part of Lot 3 and part of Lot 4 in Block 10  
 of the Durand Tract at 2861-2863 Texas in       
 C.B. 1422, 111733, Elijah Browning, subdivide   
 parcels of land at 1540 & 1546 Irving to be     
 known as `Elijah Browning Resubdivision" in     
 C.B. 5002, 111734, Joseph J. Arceneaux, a       
 parcel of ground being all of Lot 30 and part   
 of Lot 29 subdivision at Lindell, DeBaliviere   
 & Forest Park Expressway in C.B 5539-E.         
      To the Directors of Parks, Recreation      
 and Forestry and Health and Hospitals:          
 111735, Animal House, hold the Barkapalooza     
 Benefit Concert for Animal House in Forest      
 Park - Langeberg Field on October 22, 2006      
 (setup on Oct. 21st).                           
      To the Directors of Health and Hospitals   
 and Public Safety: 111736, St. Louis            
 Children's Hospital Child Development           
 Center, conduct a day care center at 321 S.     
 Newstead, 111737, Children's Enrichment         
 Center, Inc., conduct a day care center at 210  
 S. Ewing.                                       
       Communications, reports, recommenda-      
 tions and documents were submitted by Board     
 Members and action thereon taken as follows:    
                PRESIDENT                        
      Draft of the following ordinance           
 approved, and Secretary instructed to forward   
 same to Board of Aldermen with the              
 recommendation that it be passed:               
       "An ordinance authorizing and directing   
 the Board of Public Service to let contracts,   
 etc. enter into supplemental agreements with    
 the Missouri Department of Transportation,      
 Federal Highway Administration, Railroads,      
 Utilities, Developers and other Governmental    
 Agencies and otherwise provide for the design   
 and construction of the widening of             
 Loughborough Bridge over the Union Pacific      
 and associates roadway and traffic signal work 
 west of I-55 and containing an emergency       
 clause."                                       
      Preliminary approval ordered given and    
 (10) days granted in which to sign same:       
      Letting No. 8308 - Vandeventer/Prairie    
 Pavement Reconstruction, St. Louis Avenue      
 to West Florissant, Gershenson Construction    
 Co., Inc., #2 Truitt, Eureka, MO 63025,        
 Amount: $898,220.                              
      Supplemental Agreement No. 2 to P.S.A.    
 No. 990 with AAIC, Inc., for Design of New     
 West Aircraft Rescue and Fire Fighting (ARFF)  
 Building at Lambert approved and President     
 authorized to execute same.                    
      Supplemental Agreement No. 2 to P.S.A.    
 No. 997 with Science Applications              
 International Corporation for Environmental    
 Consulting Services at Lambert approved and    
 President authorized to execute same.          
      Supplemental Agreement No. 3 to P.S.A.    
 No. 997 with Science Applications              
 International Corporation for Environmental    
 Consulting Services at Lambert approved and    
 President authorized to execute same.          
      Supplemental Agreement No. 1 to P.S.A.    
 No. 1024 with Sabur, Inc., for Design of       
 Salisbury Park Development Public              
 Improvements approved and President            
 authorized to execute same.                    
      Board declared as emergency Demolition    
 of Comfort Station & Picnic Shelter, Picnic    
 Area 2 in Carondelet Park.                     
 DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC UTILITIES                   
       Board declared as emergency sawcutting   
 of concrete vaults for removal and replacement 
 of vault structure.                            
         DIRECTORS OF                           
   PUBLIC UTILITIES & STREETS                   
       2 permits for Charter Communications     
 and 1 for Sachs Electric, install communication
 systems ordered approved as follows, subject   
 to certain conditions: 111678, 17th and Lucas, 
 111679, 13th and Lucas, 111609, Forest Park    
 and Taylor.

 install three groundwater monitoring wells in  
 conjunction with Bucks, Inc., BP-669 Station

 alleyway off S. Grand and Connecticut ordered  
 approved, subject to certain conditions.

certain conditions.

JECT, ST. LOUIS, MO. Statement of

 September 8, 2006 at Board of Public              
 Service, 1200 Market, Room 301 City Hall,

 from website , under Contracts & Bids,            
 Professional Services, or call Bette Behan at     
 314-589-6214. 30% DBE participation goal.         
  PUBLIC NOTICE                                    
      A public hearing will be held by the         
 Board of Adjustment at 1:30 p.m. on               
 Wednesday, August 23, 2006, in Room 208           
 City Hall to consider the following:              
      APPEAL #8658 - Appeal filed by Gail          
 Marie Williams, from the determination of the     
 Building Commissioner in the denial of a home     
 occupancy waiver authorizing the Appellant        
 to operate a home daycare at 3415 Marcus.         
 WARD 4 HOWA ZONE: "B" - Two-Family                
 Dwelling District                                 
       APPEAL #8659 - Appeal filed by Simon        
 Sign Erection Company, from the                   
 determination of the Building Commissioner        
 in the denial of a building permit authorizing    
 the Appellant to construct one (1) wall sign      
 (illuminated) at 115 N Euclid. WARD 17            
 #AB372142-06 ZONE: "H" - Area                     
 Commercial District                               
       APPEAL #8660- Appeal filed by Warren        
 Sign Company, from the determination of the       
 Building Commissioner in the denial of a          
 building permit authorizing the Appellant to      
 install one (1) illuminated projecting wall sign  
 per plans at 522 N Grand. WARD 19                 
 AB371986-06 ZONE: "H" - Area                      
 Commercial District                               
       APPEAL #8661- Appeal filed by Fix-          
 A-Dent Auto Repair, from the determination        
 of the Building Commissioner in the denial of     
 an occupancy permit authorizing the               
 Appellant to do auto repair at 2540 Natural       
 Bridge. WARD 3 #AO373676-06 ZONE:                 
 "G" - Local Commercial and Office                 
 District                                          
       APPEAL #8568 - Appeal filed by G.           
 Borror Architect, from the determination of       
 the Building Commissioner in the denial of a      
 building permit authorizing the Appellant to      
 install one (1) wall sign per plans at 1013       
 McCausland. WARD 24 #AB356458-06                  
 ZONE: "G" - Local Commercial and                  
 Office District                                   
      In accordance with the provisions of         
 Ordinance 59981, effective July 31, 1986.         
     By authority of the Board of                  
 Adjustment.                                       
      S. Cunningham, Chairman

         NOTICE OF                           
 OPEN MEETING                                
August 14, 2006                              
12:00 pm                                     
Notice is hereby given that the Human        
Development Corporation of Metropolitan      
St. Louis will conduct a meeting at 12:00    
noon, on Friday, August 25, 2006, at 935 N.  
Vandeventer, St. Louis, MO.                  
A tentative agenda of the meeting includes:  
I.   Roll Call of Members Present            
II. Review of Minutes                        
III. Correspondence                          
IV. Reports                                  
     1) Nominating Committee Report          
     2) Chairman's Report                    
     3) Community Involvement Committee      
        Report                               
     4) Safety Committee Report              
     5) Budget and Audit Committee Report    
     6) President/CEO's Report               
 V.   Old Business                                
 VI. New Business                                 
 Representatives of the news media may obtain     
 copies of this notice by contacting:             
 Mrs. Ruth A. Smith                               
 929 North Spring Avenue                          
 St. Louis, MO 63108                              
 (314) 613-2200                                   
  PUBLIC NOTICE                                   
   NOTICE OF PROPOSED                             
 CITY CHARTER AMENDMENTS                          
       On November 7, 2006 qualified voters       
 in the City of St. Louis will consider four      
 amendments to the City Charter. These            
 amendments are contained in Ordinances           
 66911, 66912, 66913 and 66940. This Notice       
 is to advise that, pursuant to the provisions    
 of Article VI, Section 32(a) of the Missouri     
 Constitution Ordinances, 66911, 66912 and        
 66913 were published in City Journal 88-51       
 on March 21, 2006 and Ordinance 66940 was        
 published in City Journal 89-01 on April 4,      
 2006. Copies of such ordinances are available    
 in the Office of the City Register.              
     CITY OF ST. LOUIS                            
    LAMBERT-ST. LOUIS                             
 INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT(R)                         
   Request For Proposals                          
     with Qualifications                          
        Parking Capacity                          
       Consulting Services                        
      SEALED BIDS WANTED                          
      Sealed Bids will be received at the         
 Lambert International Airport, Airport           
 Properties Department, Main Terminal-MTN         
 2109, 10701 Lambert International Boulevard,     
 St. Louis, Missouri 63145 until 2:00 p.m.,       
 Monday, September 18, 2006 at which time         
 they will be publicly opened and read.           
       Bidding documents may be obtained at       
 the above address, Monday through Friday         
 between the hours of 8:30 a.m. and 5:00 p.m.,    
 or by calling (314) 890-1812. This Solicitation  
 For Bids may be obtained by visiting our         
 website at www.lambert-stlouis.com (click on     
 "Business Opportunities").                       
       Robert C. Salarano                         
       Contracts Administration Manager           
     CITY OF ST. LOUIS                                                                                 
    LAMBERT-ST. LOUIS                                                                                  
 INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT(R)                                                                              
    Solicitation For Bids                                                                              
              for                                                                                      
     Interior Live Plant                                                                               
    Maintenance Services                                                                               
        SEALED BIDS WANTED                                                                             
       Sealed Bids will be received at Lambert                                                         
 St. Louis International Airport(R), Airport                                                           
 Properties Department, Main Terminal -                                                                
 MTN 2109, 10701 Lambert International                                                                 
 Boulevard, St. Louis, Missouri 63145 until                                                            
 2:00 p.m., September 19, 2006, at which                                                               
 time the bids will be publicly opened and read.                                                       
       Bidding documents may be obtained at                                                            
 Lambert St. Louis International Airport(R),                                                           
 Airport Properties Department, Main                                                                   
 Terminal - MTN 2109, 10701 Lambert                                                                    
 International Boulevard, St. Louis,                                                                   
 Missouri, Monday through Friday between                                                               
 the hours of 8:30 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., or by                                                           
 calling (314) 426-8031. This Solicitation For                                                         
 Bids may be obtained by visiting our website                                                          
 at www.lambert-stlouis.com (Click on                                                                  
 "Business Opportunities").                                                                            
             Robert Salarano                                                                           
             Contracts Administration Manager

 to the St. Louis Living Wage Ordinance 65597                                                          
 and the Regulations associated therewith."                                                            
   DEPARTMENT                                                                                          
  OF PERSONNEL                                                                                         
          NOTICE OF EXAMINATIONS                                                                       
             The City of St. Louis, Department of                                                      
 Personnel, 1114 Market Street, Room 700,                                                              
 announces competitive Civil Service                                                                   
 examinations to fill vacancies in the Municipal                                                       
 Service.

       The last date for filing an application for                                                     
 the following examination is August 25, 2006.

   LIVING WAGE REQUIREMENTS                                                                                                   
Bidders [Proponents] are hereby advised that                                                                                  
the St. Louis Living Wage Ordinance #65597                                   TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 12, 2006                      
and associated Regulations apply to the                                                                                       
                                                                            ALLEN & HEARTH AUDIO BOARD                        
service [concession] [lease] [City Financial                                                                                  
                                                                            for furnishing the Communications Division        
Assistance] for which [bids] [proposals] are                                                                                  
                                                                            per Req. #1.                                      
being sought herein. This Ordinance requires                                                                                  
that, unless specific exemptions apply, all                                   2007 CHEVROLET COLORADO                         
individuals who perform work pursuant to a                                          EXTENDED CAB                              
contract executed between the successful                                    for furnishing the Water Division per Req.        
[bidder] [proponent] and the City [Agency]                                  #1072.                                            
must be paid a minimum of the applicable                                                                                      
Living Wage rates set forth in the attached                                                                                   
Living Wage Bulletin, and, if the rates are                                       Bidders are invited to be present at the    
adjusted during the term of the contract                                    opening of bids. Bid results may be available     
pursuant to the Ordinance, applicable rates                                 30 days following the date of bid opening.        
after such adjustment is made. Each bidder                                  If you desire bid results, please include a       
[proponent] must submit the attached "Living                                self-address, stamped envelope with your bid.     
Wage Acknowledgment and Acceptance                                                                                            
      The City of St. Louis desires to       
 purchase recycled products whenever         
 possible, especially items containing post  
 consumer waste materials. If your company   
 can supply recycled products, please provide
 information to this office.                 
      The right to reject any and all bids is
 reserved.                                   
                Freddie L. Dunlap            
                Supply Commissioner          
                (314) 622-4580               
                www.stlouis.missouri.org

 contract and the imposition of additional

 Regulations.                                                      Freddie L. Dunlap

    SUPPLY                                                                                      
 COMMISSIONER                                                                                   
 Office of the Supply Commissioner,                                                             
 Room 324, City Hall, 1200 Market Street,                                                       
 St. Louis, Missouri 63103, Tuesday,                                                            
 August 22, 2006 - ADVERTISED BIDS                                                              
 will be received by the undersigned to be                                                      
 opened at the office at 12:00 o'clock noon, for                                                
 the items listed below on the dates specified.                                                 
         Notice to All Suppliers                                                                
       NOTE: It is the policy of the City of                                                    
 St. Louis that all firms desiring to do business                                               
 with the City of St. Louis must comply with                                                    
 employment practices that are in accordance                                                    
 with the ordinances of the City of St. Louis                                                   
 and the Mayor's Executive Order promulgated                                                    
 there-under to the end that all Contractors                                                    
 and suppliers of materials and services will                                                   
 offer equal opportunity for employment and                                                     
 job advancement to blacks and other minority                                                   
 groups in the St. Louis Metropolitan area.                                                     
             Requesting a Bid                                                                   
 To have a bid mailed or faxed to you, please                                                   
 contact the Supply Commissioner's office at                                                    
 (314) 622-4580.                                                                                
  TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 12, 2006                                                                   
 ALLEN & HEARTH AUDIO BOARD                                                                     
 for furnishing the Communications Division                                                     
 per Req. #1.                                                                                   
   2007 CHEVROLET COLORADO                                                                      
         EXTENDED CAB                                                                           
 for furnishing the Water Division per Req.                                                     
 #1072.                                                                                         
       Bidders are invited to be present at the                                                 
 opening of bids. Bid results may be available                                                  
 30 days following the date of bid opening.                                                     
 If you desire bid results, please include a                                                    
 self-address, stamped envelope with your bid.
